page.title: 09Living on Brooks Farm
page.content: Brooks Farm is three hundred years old. In the summer when it is very hot ducks come to swim on our pond with their ducklings. In the morning I walk up the lane to catch the bus. When I get past the gate there are pheasants everywhere. When I get halfway up the lane there are bulls in the field. It is very quiet there. We have a brook which runs through a field. We are trying to make it run in the ditch under the hedge because the field is always wet. We have two dogs, two cats and two horses. We have a wreck of a barn. We are trying to find out what sort of barn it is. We think it is a hay barn.
